Blocks Template

FAQ

 

html

<section class="padded">

  <h2 class="centered padded-1"> FAQs </h2>

  <!-- dl stands for description list, with a description title and a description description -->
  <dl class="accordion light-bg padded-1">

    <dt><a href="">Panel 1</a></dt>
    <dd>Pellentesque fermentum dolor. Aliquam quam lectus, facilisis auctor, ultrices ut, elementum vulputate, nunc.</dd>

    <dt><a href="">Panel 2</a></dt>
    <dd>Donec nec justo eget felis facilisis fermentum. Aliquam porttitor mauris sit amet orci. Aenean dignissim pellentesque felis.</dd>

    <dt><a href="">Panel 3</a></dt>
    <dd>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Phasellus hendrerit. Pellentesque aliquet nibh nec urna. In nisi neque, aliquet vel, dapibus id, mattis vel, nisi. Sed pretium, ligula sollicitudin laoreet viverra, tortor libero sodales leo,
      eget blandit nunc tortor eu nibh. Nullam mollis. Ut justo. Suspendisse potenti.</dd>

  </dl>
</section>

css


.accordion dt a {
  padding: 0.25rem;
  margin: 0.25rem 0;
  display:block;
  color: #e67e22;
  position: relative;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.accordion dd {
  padding: 0.5rem;
}

/* Accordian Icon */
.accordion dt a::after {
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  right: 0;
  display: block;
  width: 1rem;
  height: 1rem;
  line-height: 1;
  text-align: center;
  -webkit-transition: all .35s;
  -o-transition: all .35s;
  transition: all .35s;
}

.accordion dt a::after {
  content: "+";
}
.open::after {
  transform: rotateZ(45deg);
}

//This makes sure the page is ready befor running the scripts
$(document).ready(function() {

//This hides all the answers
  var allPanels = $('.accordion > dd').hide();

   //This looks for when a question is clicked on
    $('.accordion > dt > a').click(function() {

    //This slides all the pannels up
      allPanels.slideUp();

   //This looks to see if the link has the class of open. If it has a class of open then remove it and add a class of closing
      $(this).filter('.open').removeClass('open').addClass('closing')

   //This removes open off of all the other questions
      $('.accordion > dt > a').removeClass('open');

  //This looks to see if the element has the class of closing that we just added. if it doesnt then open up th questions answer
    $(this).not(".closing").addClass('open').parent().next().slideDown();

  //This removes the class of closing so that we are ready to go again once a new question is clicked on
      $('.accordion > dt > a').removeClass('closing');

  //This makes it so that when you click on the link it wont go back to the top of the page
      return false;
    });

});
